searchDocs.title: Pre-Requisite​
searchDocs.content: Not recommended for beginners.

searchDocs.title: Example 2
searchDocs.content: Example 2 Using getPercentage() with [0, 1] Range. local HyperDigits = require("/path/to/HyperDigits") local a = HyperDigits.new(5) local b = HyperDigits.new(10) print(HyperDigits.getPercentage(5, 10)) --should print 0.5

searchDocs.title: Datastore Pseudocode
searchDocs.content: Datastore Pseudocode local HyperDigits = require("/path/to/HyperDigits") local currentData = HyperDigits.fromString("1e123") local dataRaw = currentData:toBase() --convert HyperDigits into raw table --logic for storing it in your datastore ------------------------------------------------------------- --initializing raw table back into HyperDigits local dataRaw --logic for retrieving data from datastore, should be equivalent to the dataRaw above. local retrievedData = HyperDigits.new(dataRaw) --continue doing whatever

searchDocs.title: Example 1
searchDocs.content: Example 1 Using the Constructor new() With Simple Operations local HyperDigits = require("/path/to/HyperDigits") local myNumber = HyperDigits.new(10) --Ways to do operations myNumber += HyperDigits.new(10) --Obviously the best way myNumber = HyperDigits.add(myNumber, HyperDigits.new(10)) print(myNumber:toNumber()) --should print 30 local myNumber2 = HyperDigits.new(420) myNumber2 -= HyperDigits.new(353) myNumber2 = myNumber2 * HyperDigits.new(67) -- or *= like above with the -= print(myNumber2:toNumber()) --should print 4489 print(myNumber2) --defaults to suffix abbreviation; should print 4.49K Using Other Constructors local HyperDigits = require("/path/to/HyperDigits") local a = HyperDigits.fromString("1e67") --a better version of .new(), takes in numbers, scientific, scientific chain, suffixes local b = HyperDigits.fromPercent(10) print(a) --should print 10UVt print(a + b) --should print 11UVt because 10 + 10% is lowkey 11 :OOOOOO local c = HyperDigits.fromScientific("1.5K") --practically a wrapper for fromString/you can just use fromString. Just a syntax thing. print(c * HyperDigits.new(2)) --should print 3K

searchDocs.title: Leaderboard Pseudocode
searchDocs.content: Leaderboard Pseudocode What we have here is a pseudocode in how you would get this working with leaderboards. IMPORTANT NOTE: fromString already handles JSONDecoding internally. Therefore why you don't see JSONDecode anywhere. local DataStoreService = game:GetService("DataStoreService") local HttpService = game:GetService("HttpService") local Players = game:GetService("Players") local HyperDigits = require("HyperDigits") local currentData = HyperDigits.fromString("1e123") local leaderboardStore = DataStoreService:GetOrderedDataStore("qwerty") local valueStore = DataStoreService:GetDataStore("abcdef") type userData = { key: string, value: number } local function saveData(player: Player, value: HyperDigits.HyperDigits) local current = value:encode() if typeof(current) ~= "number" then return end local key = tostring(player.UserId) leaderboardStore:UpdateAsync(key, function(old) old = old or 0 if current > old then return current end return old end) local base = value:toBase() local json = HttpService:JSONEncode(base) valueStore:SetAsync(key, json) end local function getDisplayValue(userId: number, encoded: number) local key = tostring(userId) local success, value = pcall(function() return valueStore:GetAsync(key) end) if success and type(value) == "string" and value ~= "" then local toFormat = HyperDigits.fromString(value) return toFormat:toString() end return HyperDigits.decode(encoded):toString() end local function getTop(size: number) local pages = leaderboardStore:GetSortedAsync(true, size) local page = pages:GetCurrentPage() local rows = {} for rank, entry: userData in page do local userId = tonumber(entry.key) local encoded = entry.value if userId then local display = getDisplayValue(userId, encoded) table.insert(rows, { rank = rank; userId = userId; encoded = encoded; display = display; }) end end return rows end local top_10 = getTop(10) for _, row in top_10 do print(`Rank: {row.rank}`) print(`Player: {Players:GetPlayerByUserId(row.userId).Name}`) print(`Amount: {row.display}`) end

searchDocs.title: GOOGOL​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.GOOGOL: HyperDigits Represents 10^100

searchDocs.title: GOOGOLPLEX​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.GOOGOLPLEX: HyperDigits Represents 10^(10^100)

searchDocs.title: GOOGOLPLEXPLEX​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.GOOGOLPLEXPLEX: HyperDigits Represents 10^(10^(10^100))

searchDocs.title: TRITRI​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.TRITRI: HyperDigits Represents some already really big number, but below tetration.

searchDocs.title: TRITET​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.TRITET: HyperDigits Represents some already really big number WITH tetration.

searchDocs.title: GRAHAM1​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.GRAHAM1: HyperDigits A number possibly beyond hyperverse level. Still below the TREE function.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.new(number: number | BaseHyperDigits) → HyperDigits Creates a new HyperDigits from a number or BaseHyperDigits.

searchDocs.title: fromOnoe​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.fromOnoe(onoeNum: { mantissa: number, exponent: number } & BaseHyperDigits) → BaseHyperDigits Converts an Onoe-style value. Inherited from AlyaNum.

searchDocs.title: fromOmega​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.fromOmega(onum: unknown) → HyperDigits Converts an OmegaNum-style value into HyperDigits. Inherited from AlyaNum.

searchDocs.title: fromString​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.fromString(str: string) → HyperDigits Parses a string into HyperDigits. Supports: Plain numbers: "123", "-123" Scientific: "1e3", "1e-3" Scientific-chain: "1e1e123" Suffix: "1.23K" --Currently only works up to No and does NOT support saberSuffixes. If parse fails, returns 0.

searchDocs.title: toBase​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.toBase(self: HyperDigits) → BaseHyperDigits Converts self into table format. Used for datastore savings/structure view.

searchDocs.title: getPercentage​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.getPercentage( numerator: HyperDigits, denominator: HyperDigits ) → HyperDigits Computes a clamped fraction: numerator/denominator in [0, 1]. Rounds to 0.001.

searchDocs.title: fromPercent​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.fromPercent(percent: string | number) → HyperDigits Creates a fractional value from a percent input. Ex: fromPercent(12) -> 0.12 fromPercent("12.3%") -> 0.123

searchDocs.title: toPercent​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.toPercent(number: HyperDigits) → string Formats a fractional value as a percent string. Relative to: PERCENT_DECIMAL_POINTS

searchDocs.title: fromScientific​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.fromScientific(str: string) → HyperDigits Alias of fromString() for scientific inputs.

searchDocs.title: changeSuffixes​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.changeSuffixes(newSuffixes: table) → () Overrides the suffix table used by toSuffix() and suffix parsing. No clue why you would wanna override that but sure.

searchDocs.title: changeDecimalPoints​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.changeDecimalPoints(decimalPoints: number) → () Sets decimal places used in formatted output.

searchDocs.title: changeDefaultAbbreviation​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.changeDefaultAbbreviation(mode: "suffix" | "scientific" | "saber") → () Sets the default abbreivation mode used by toString(): "suffix" "scientific" "saber"

searchDocs.title: lbencode​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.lbencode(self: HyperDigits) → number Lossy order-preserving encode into a single roblox number for leaderboard/ranking usage.

searchDocs.title: lbdecode​
searchDocs.content: </> Public.lbdecode(int: number) → HyperDigits Decodes a value produced by lbdecode() into an approximate HyperDigits.

searchDocs.title: add​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:add( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Adds number to self. Percent behavior: If number is a percent, this applies self + (self * number).

searchDocs.title: sub​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:sub( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Subtracts number from self. Percent behavior: If number is a percent, this applies: self - (self * number).

searchDocs.title: mul​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:mul( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Multiplies self by number.

searchDocs.title: div​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:div( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Divides self by number.

searchDocs.title: pow​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:pow( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Raises self to the power number.

searchDocs.title: mod​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:mod( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns self % number. Percent behavior: If number is a percent, this applies: self % (self * number).

searchDocs.title: root​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:root( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Takes the number-th root of self.

searchDocs.title: equals​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:equals( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns true if self and number are exactly equal in representation.

searchDocs.title: lessThan​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:lessThan( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns true if self < number.

searchDocs.title: lessEquals​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:lessEquals( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns true if self <= number.

searchDocs.title: moreThan​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:moreThan( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns true if self > number.

searchDocs.title: moreEquals​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:moreEquals( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns true if self >= number.

searchDocs.title: compare​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:compare( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Compares self and number. Returns: 1 if self > number 0 if equal -1 if self < number

searchDocs.title: abs​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:abs(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Returns the absolute value of self.

searchDocs.title: log10​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:log10(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Base-10 algorithm. For self <= 0, returns 0.

searchDocs.title: log​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:log( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Logarithm of self in the given base.

searchDocs.title: floor​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:floor(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Floors self when safely representable; otherwise returns self.

searchDocs.title: round​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:round(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Rounds self when safely representable; otherwise returns self.

searchDocs.title: ceil​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:ceil(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Ceils self when safely representable; otherwise returns self.

searchDocs.title: isInteger​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:isInteger(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Returns true if self is an integer. For values beyond safe integer resolution, automatically returns true.

searchDocs.title: reciprocal​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:reciprocal(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Returns the reciprocal: 1/self.

searchDocs.title: lambertw​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:lambertw(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Lambert W function: W(self). If you lowkey wanna learn more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambert_W_function

searchDocs.title: slog​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:slog( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Super-logarithm with given base(used for tetration). If you lowkey wanna learn more: https://andydude.github.io/tetration/archives/tetration2/slog.html Returns nil if the iteration fails to unite.

searchDocs.title: pentlog​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:pentlog( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Pentation-logarithm with given base(used for pentation). If you lowkey wanna learn more: https://oeis.org/wiki/Penta-logarithms Returns nil if the iteration fails to unite.

searchDocs.title: hextlog​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:hextlog( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Hexation-logarithm with given base(used for pentation). If you lowkey wanna learn more: https://oeis.org/wiki/Penta-logarithms Returns nil if the iteration fails to unite.

searchDocs.title: tet​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:tet( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Tetration self ^^ number.

searchDocs.title: pent​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:pent( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Pentation self ^^^ number.

searchDocs.title: hext​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:hext( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Hexation self ^^^^ number.

searchDocs.title: unary​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:unary(self: HyperDigits) → HyperDigits Returns the additive inverse: -self.

searchDocs.title: min​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:min( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns the minimum of self and number.

searchDocs.title: max​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:max( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns the maximum of self and number.

searchDocs.title: max​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:max( self: HyperDigits, number: Number ) → HyperDigits Returns (min, max) for self and number.

searchDocs.title: toString​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toString(self: Number) → HyperDigits Primary string formatter. Automatically picks appropriate abbreviations depending on magnitude.

searchDocs.title: toSerika​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toSerika(self: Number) → HyperDigits Returns Serika stuff. Inherited from AlyaNum.

searchDocs.title: toNumber​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toNumber(self: Number) → HyperDigits Converts to real number, although may return inf for extreme values.

searchDocs.title: toSuffix​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toSuffix(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats using standard suffixes: K, M, B, T, etc when available.

searchDocs.title: toSaberSuffix​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toSaberSuffix(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats using slightly modified suffixes from the roblox game Saber Simulator. Game link: https://rblx.games/3823781113

searchDocs.title: toScientific​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toScientific(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats as scientific notation; may switch to scientific-chain for extreme values.

searchDocs.title: toScientificChain​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toScientificChain(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats as scientific-chain: "1e" followed by a compact exponent string.

searchDocs.title: toEChain​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toEChain(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats as e-chain: e...x; may promote to Ent for really really extreme values.

searchDocs.title: toEnt​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toEnt(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats as Ent: E(k)<x>; may promote to HyperE for REALLY REALLY REALLY extreme values.

searchDocs.title: toHyperE​
searchDocs.content: </> Public:toHyperE(self: Number) → HyperDigits Formats as hyper-E with layered # parts.
